extendedIngredients.name: diced ham
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup diced ham (I purchase this in a bag in the meat section)
metaInformation: (I purchase this in a bag in the meat section)

extendedIngredients.name: pie shell
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pre-made pie shell (I recommend Marie Callender's in your grocer's freezer)
metaInformation: (I recommend Marie Callender's in your grocer's freezer)

recipes.title: Easy Ham and Cheesy Quiche

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, White Burgundy, and Champagne are my top picks for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Mouton Cadet Bordeaux Rouge with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mouton Cadet Bordeaux Rouge
productMatches.description: Through its balance, roundness and aging capacity, the fruits of generous nature and the work of human hands, Mouton Cadet Rouge express all the richness and diversity of one of the world's foremost winegrowing regions.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 375“Pam” a small pan and sauté onions with ham for appx 5 mins.Pour sauted ham and onions and shredded cheese into premade pie shell.Beat eggs with heavy cream until well blended, add salt and pepper.Pour over top.Bake 35-45 mins until set. (When you take the quiche out of the oven, the middle of the pie should not jiggle)

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375“Pam” a small pan and sauté onions with ham for appx 5 mins.
Pour sauted ham and onions and shredded cheese into premade pie shell.Beat eggs with heavy cream until well blended, add salt and pepper.
Bake 35-45 mins until set. (When you take the quiche out of the oven, the middle of the pie should not jiggle)
